brief.brief: Determines whether the next script can run.
An unknown condition (blank field) evaluates to false.

detail.detail: To base an exit condition on the value of an input field, use the $script file variable.
This example tests the input field name for the value "joe":

The script evaluates the conditions in this field from the top down at processing time. The script associated with the first condition that evaluates to true, is the next script to run. If there are no specified exits, or if all conditions evaluate to false, the script flow is complete and processing control returns to the calling application.
The Next Script and Condition fields are independent arrays. Scroll each array separately to keep the script names synchronized with their corresponding conditions.
The script maintenance applications check for Format Control add and display options on the scripts form. You can define Format Control statements if desired.
